column1: I’ll continue pushing the Senate to finally deliver another coronavirus relief package; meanwhile let’s show support by buying local.

A huge lump of coal in your stocking: The day after Christmas millions will lose benefits that have helped them make it through this pandemic. UI is expiring. Gig workers and the self-employed will be on their own. The Senate must pass covid relief for the American people! https://t.co/qW3NQYN22h

As we enter the cold weather months and COVID surges it’s more important than ever that families be able to stay home and stay safe through this pandemic. That’s not possible without water electricity and broadband. The Senate should pass my utility shutoff moratorium bill.

A tragic new milestone: COVID-19 has now killed more than 800 Oregonians. Yesterday Oregon set new records in cases deaths and hospitalizations. As we await widespread distribution of a vaccine it is incumbent upon each and every one of us to help slow the spread of COVID.

A quarter of a million Americans have now died from COVID. This is a heartbreaking tragedy—and worse it was preventable. To all those who have lost a friend a family member or a neighbor to this pandemic: You’re in my prayers.

We’re receiving great news when it comes to the effectiveness of COVID vaccines. But it will be on the incoming Biden administration to manage the distribution of these vaccines. Delays in the transition hurt the planning process. It’s time for the GSA to act.

The Senate should be back to work on Covid relief for small businesses and working families. We should be taking up the HEROES Act to invest in PPE and provide hospitals with critical resources. We should not be back to stacking our courts with Trump judicial nominees.

Today is the 7th straight day of 100000+ COVID cases. I would say it’s unbelievable but sadly it’s all too believable. This is the direct result of the president’s failure of leadership and refusal to treat this like the crisis it is.

President Trump failed our nation in many ways. He failed to lead a national response to COVID-19.  He failed to build a better health care system promising but failing to end the gouging of Americans on drug prices while working to destroy insurance for 20 million Americans.

Covid relief is critical to helping families. It’s also about ensuring that state & local governments have the resources to get this pandemic under control. There’s no back to ‘normal’ until states have the resources they need to get safe effective vaccines out to communities. https://t.co/HUhjXorDAC
Trump says US has done a great job and COVID is going away... even as infection rates go through the roof and deaths soar.  And still Trump has no comprehensive plan.

A voter suppression epidemic: This accommodation to slow the spread of COVID and help Americans with disabilities has been thrown out. The extremists on the Supreme Court are actively working to make it harder for the people of Alabama to vote. https://t.co/yL9D93uBO8

~220000 Americans have died from Covid. If Trump had led America to tackle Covid with the same competence as Canada only about 86000 Americans would have died. In other words you could say the deaths of 135000 Americans are the direct result of Trump’s failed leadership.

The ACA was life-changing for people with pre-existing conditions. @choo_ek and I discussed how Trump's #SCOTUS nominee is a threat to everyone with pre-existing conditions including the millions of Americans who have survived #COVID19. Full conversation: https://t.co/HZLTECUauo https://t.co/emK7viTjvx

America deserves better than an election-time stunt. How about a COVID relief bill that meets the needs of working families boosts the economy beats back the virus? Or just a chance to amend McConnell’s pretend-to-care bill to address people’s real needs?https://t.co/rRrVCL9YEL

You may wonder why this hearing is moving forward today despite a COVID outbreak. Here’s a big part of the answer: Republicans see this vacancy as their last ditch effort to overturn the ACA and take away YOUR protections for preexisting conditions. That’s #WhatsAtStake.

I stand with @OregonNurses at @goodshcs who are demanding a safe workplace. Nurses and all health care heroes deserve to know if they’ve been exposed to COVID-19 as they risk their lives caring for our loved ones. https://t.co/BRr2S7Oc0d

The CDC tried to warn us that COVID spreads through the air—but Trump pressured them to take the warnings back. Finally this important guidance is official again. Read it wear a mask if you’re near others outdoors and avoid extended time in indoor spaces whenever possible. https://t.co/rWpmLSlEC8

We’ve seen a super spreader event at the White House. We don’t need another one next week at the Senate. The Supreme Court confirmation process should be delayed until science—not politics—says it’s safe. If we are to act let it FINALLY be on COVID relief.

The House just passed ANOTHER COVID bill. McConnell should be focused on getting this pandemic under control not dropping everything to illegitimately ram through a Supreme Court nomination. https://t.co/CeC1oCx9pl

The President & First Lady’s positive COVID tests serve as a reminder to all that this virus is extremely serious none of us is immune and that it is important to take precautions like wearing a mask to protect ourselves & those around us. Wishing them both a speedy recovery.

Trump pushed the CDC to cook the books on the potential harm children could suffer from coronavirus infections putting his political objectives above children's health. This is a horrific act. Our president should be protecting not endangering children. https://t.co/UB2ETYZZkD

The HEROES Act would provide COVID relief to families that desperately need it. It has sat on McConnell’s desk SINCE MAY.   Yet within DAYS of RBG’s passing the GOP was rushing this process forward. Their misplaced priorities are on display for all of us to see.

For the Senate GOP COVID relief can wait. McConnell said himself there’s no “urgency.” Now weeks before an election and with Americans already voting they’re tripping over themselves to approve a nominee practically in record time. Sickening.
There has been a complete shutdown of COVID relief by the Senate GOP. But they can move with lightning speed to ram through an illegitimate Court nomination. https://t.co/PM8hDmdM9l

.@realDonaldTrump —Things don't just magically go away. You were wrong when you said it about COVID & you're wrong again on climate chaos. If you saw what I've seen over the past few days in Oregon you'd sing a different tune. Science is right you are wrong. https://t.co/RRh3bo37Ps

Trump's COVID response has been a horrific failure—and we now know it was an intentional cover-up from the start. Trump misled the American people at the most critical moment and the pandemic has been much worse as a result. Trump lied Americans died…by the tens of thousands. https://t.co/z6T7oTrqZ9

This is a new low. As we hit 6 mil Covid cases and schools around the country are reopening @FEMA is cutting off states from PPE? @realDonaldTrump we can’t bear any more of your cruelty and incompetence. Stop this deadly and stupid decision now. https://t.co/jKcSag07W5

After the Trump admin tried to end waivers for school meals during COVID I fought back. Now USDA will extend the Free Meals for Kids through the end of the year. A win for communities across America & for the children who desperately need this support. https://t.co/ax4KMlGcQP

This tidal wave would be catastrophic for families and local economies. I worked with @SenWarren and @SenKamalaHarris to introduce a nationwide moratorium on utility shut-offs. Congress must include our bill in the next COVID relief. https://t.co/nFDmfNxQiJ
The country would be much better off if @realDonaldTrump spent as much time and attention trying to beat COVID as he does trying to violate federal ethics laws.

Nurses. Farmworkers. Childcare providers. Essential workers from grocery stores to hospitals have been on the frontline of the pandemic. The next COVID relief bill must provide them with the resources they need to do their jobs as safely as possible.

This data from @CenterOnBudget is a gut-wrenching reminder of what’s at stake if Congress fails to pass coronavirus relief package. With no action it will be our children who pay the highest price. View their full report here: https://t.co/kxHMvnizNe https://t.co/E8LT9VLPYG

The White House may want to ignore the uncontrolled spread of COVID—but Americans can’t. We need resources and coordination in order to save lives and end the pandemic. The next bill MUST focus on getting this virus under control. https://t.co/zWNz2iKsHm

OSHA has refused to support America’s farmworkers. As a result 5600+ farmworkers have now tested positive for COVID. America’s food supply relies on these workers. It’s essential that we protect them – we should include the FARM Act in the COVID bill. https://t.co/R85oALteYM

Now when families are being asked to stay home to prevent the spread of coronavirus would be the worst possible time for a family to lose access to electricity and water. Congress must include a utility shutoff moratorium in the next COVID response bill. https://t.co/IF0jIrlzDD

Received this letter from @AFTOregon Portland @NAACP @SEIU @OregonAFSCME and more alarmed at Senate GOP’s “woefully inadequate” COVID aid bill. They’re right & I’m fighting w/ everything I’ve got to get a bill that helps REAL PEOPLE IN NEED. Not corporations & uber wealthy. https://t.co/BxorGzV8VD

Senate Republicans aren’t treating this moment like the global health crisis it is. They’re not treating it like the historic economic downturn it is. Instead of a pathetic box-checking effort they need to get serious about beating COVID & getting Americans the support they need https://t.co/M7IVAWqAXf

Millions of children seniors & people with disabilities face food insecurity because of COVID. We need to INCREASE SNAP extend Pandemic EBT & renew the $600/wk UI to help Americans put food on the table. Lobbyists can pay for their own damn martinis. https://t.co/yaGGCZ5ly5

Rent is due tomorrow & McConnell just let $600/week in UI expire for millions of Americans fighting to survive COVID's fallout. The House extended this months ago but Senate Rs are instead cutting families’ incomes when they can least afford it.  Shameful. https://t.co/whTfpY7MoC

Rep Gohmert made staff come in unnecessarily berated them for wearing masks & risked exposing them AGAIN once he knew he had COVID! This is exactly the kind of reckless behavior Senate Rs would enable w/ their employers liability shield. NO! We must protect workers & customers. https://t.co/8pQLcBP0fl

We can’t in good conscience tell Americans to #StayHomeStaySafe & then pull the rug out from under families in crisis. The next COVID relief bill MUST have a utility moratorium. Honored to be in this fight with you Congresswoman & @RepRashida @SenWarren @SenKamalaHarris. https://t.co/bNWR2po2Vg

McConnell’s COVID bill is a parade of horribles: Want a $400 tax subsidy for three martini lunches? You got it. Money for hungry American children? Too bad. Want to cut support for workers who’ve lost their jobs? Sure. A moratorium on utility cutoffs and evictions? No dice. (1/2)

LIVE NOW: I'm sitting down w/ Oregonians for a virtual town hall & we're streaming it to Facebook. Join us as we talk about everything that is happening in the world today: from the unmarked secret police to COVID-19 to ending systemic racism and more: https://t.co/Oe89hk7EqJ https://t.co/hUFFvEOWex

More than 76000 new cases of coronavirus reported yesterday & Trump is trying to block billions of dollars for testing contact tracing & disease control efforts that will save lives. What kind of leader chooses a path in which thousands more will die? https://t.co/Q5DTMZGm9z

I can’t imagine Oregon w/out a vibrant music & entertainment industry. Our artists event staff & venues are woven into the fabric of our communities. Proud to be working w/ @SenatorBennet to pass #RESTARTAct & protect these small businesses & workers during COVID-19. https://t.co/x5dhBsTaaZ

This is politicization of govt at its worst. Trump is sidelining CDC so he can manipulate the data for political gain. To fight COVID-19 we need transparency + scientific integrity not campaign politics. @realdonaldtrump: Return the data to CDC & give the public full access. https://t.co/9YTnsyk4do

Millions of Americans are losing health coverage along w/ their jobs yet @SenateGOP @realDonaldTrump keep trying to make care harder to get—even during COVID. This crisis shows why we need a simple seamless health care system that covers everyone by virtue of living in America.

The Trump Administration’s xenophobia is on display again. This time they’re threatening to throw student visa holders out of the US for no reason other than their colleges moving online to keep students & staff safe from COVID. It's just wrong & cruel. https://t.co/IXqennnvKB

The Trump administration is letting Big Pharma profit off of COVID-19 drugs w/ no commitment the American people will get a fair price. Taxpayers are funding the R&D for a COVID-19 vaccine & it should ABSOLUTELY be made available to all Americans for free. https://t.co/xDfTN7TpdZ

.@AmericanAir: how many Americans will die bc you fill middle seats w/ your customers shoulder to shoulder hour after hour. This is incredibly irresponsible. People eat & drink on planes & must take off masks to do so. No way you aren’t facilitating spread of COVID infections. https://t.co/PWG5macqgC

.@SenateMajLdr: Bring the HEROES Act to the Floor and #CancelRecess. More than 128000 are dead. Millions more unemployed. Leaving without a response to COVID-19 is an abdication of our most basic duties. https://t.co/fub9muAvXQ https://t.co/V0pzP2WD3X

As of today Oregon is under a statewide enforced mask mandate. Any chance we have at reopening our economy hinges on being able to control the spread of COVID-19. Wearing a mask in public indoor spaces will help Oregon do just that. #MaskUp https://t.co/MZZwLdOqS1

Farmworkers are essential to America’s food supply. But millions of farmworkers are w/out the most basic protections in the midst of COVID-19. We need to step up & protect America's farmworkers regardless of immigration status. #FARMAct https://t.co/AsUXjKjGG0

.@realDonaldTrump said he slowed down testing & now there’s NEW information from @PattyMurray @SenSchumer that Trump admin has failed to distribute $14 BILLION in COVID-19 testing + contract tracing funds. While people are dying by the tens of thousands. https://t.co/gpcO0uPHpF

Nearly 30000 additional Americans have lost their lives to COVID-19 since the House passed the HEROES Act on May 15. Millions more have filed for unemployment insurance. But @SenateGOP does nothing. We MUST bring the HEROES Act to the Floor before July 4. https://t.co/rGtZR8a5KF https://t.co/S0s3BmLu5T

Cruelty & bigotry is the driving force of this administration. They should be working to get a handle on COVID a crisis that‘s killed more than 113000 Americans ON THEIR WATCH. Instead they’re busy making sure LGBTQ Americans can be discriminated against when they need care. https://t.co/dTy4dOM6IT

Today I led 31 Senators in a call for $47B in financial support for students & higher ed institutions in the next coronavirus aid bill. Higher Ed is a ladder to opportunity for countless Americans & builds a competitive workforce. We must protect it. https://t.co/rtABK3vBsb

THREAD: Coronavirus has understandably been off front pages this last week but 113000 Americans have died from COVID-19. Cases are spiking across the country. And the "strategic testing plan" the @WhiteHouse recently  submitted is a joke.  Let’s look at its many shortcomings...

Initial Covid-19 test: botched PPE distribution: botched Test distribution: botched Small biz aid rollout: botched Remdesivir distribution: botched  Trump administration incompetence is crippling America’s response to this crisis. https://t.co/JnDGsfYPwV https://t.co/CgtNPSObrV

This Memorial Day weekend please remember that the danger of COVID-19 is still far from gone. If you go out be vigilant and follow strict social distancing. Your actions could save the lives of those you love. https://t.co/qVaFh9F4sU

This is tragic. I've been to the Rohingya refugee camps - hard to express how crowded they are & how quickly COVID-19 could spread. Critical that aid groups are given access ASAP & that refugees get the resources they need for hygiene & self-protection. https://t.co/KZb9r6WWOt

China fears a second wave of COVID-19 may be starting again in Wuhan so they are testing all 11 MILLION residents. In ten days! That’s more tests than Americans have had in 4 months because @realdonaldtrump has failed to implement a national testing strategy.

Developing a successful COVID-19 vaccine may be the most important public health undertaking of our lifetimes. We can’t afford to repeat PPE and testing debacles so I’ve joined @PattyMurray to demand a public strategy briefing from the administration: https://t.co/WJBuGZSqhM

This has to be an urgent wakeup call for Trump and McConnell. Americans are living through Great Depression-level economic collapse health workers still don’t have the testing and PPE they need and in most of the country COVID-19 cases are on the rise.

There are more than 1 million COVID patients across US & nurses are right there on the front lines—saving lives comforting families & ensuring we get to the other side of this. Honored to join @SenatorWicker in thanking these heroes. #NationalNursesWeek https://t.co/tf23vnlRQ3

Physical distancing at this AM’s hearing. Disturbing that McConnell reconvened Senate—endangering countless staff Capitol Police food service & maintenance workers—yet we are doing nothing to fix Admin’s bungled COVID-19 response or to provide urgently-needed additional relief. https://t.co/hnfeyg4LiU

Back in my Senate office to fight for the fixes to Corona aid....and back to my toaster PB&J lunches. It’s no tuna melt and my team is worried about the 5-week-old bread... But it tastes pretty good and so far no ill effect! https://t.co/2zhwst6j4N
This is a huge accusation—that COVID-19 is genetically engineered. Mr. Secretary show us the “enormous evidence.” https://t.co/59HZ8b72ct

This is how we get through COVID-19—by community members taking care of their communities. If you can please continue supporting and buying from local farmers makers and shopkeepers. Look forward to enjoying a @DoubleMountain brew soon. 🍻 https://t.co/bk0XJY32vB

This administration’s slow and disjointed response to COVID-19 has put our servicemen and women and their families at risk—and undermined military readiness in the process. I expect a hell of a lot more from Secretary Esper and our Commander in Chief. https://t.co/F6VPJIiUd8

We all know the playbook by now. Whenever Trump wants to change the subject he says something racist/draconian about immigration. He has failed the response to coronavirus & has no plan for testing/tracing. Americans know it his poll numbers are falling—so voila same old song. https://t.co/epPCAmuFJp

Donald Trump just funneled HALF A BILLION DOLLARS OF TAXPAYER MONEY to political allies during an election year to pursue his No. 1 campaign pet project but still doesn’t have a plan for nationwide coronavirus testing so we can end this crisis. https://t.co/xw0INdLrBj

FIRST: Trump has fired the head of the coronavirus aid oversight panel—a nonpartisan DoD inspector general whose job it was to make sure taxpayer dollars went where they’re supposed to and not into slush funds for political allies. (2/) https://t.co/E77nCcsSi8

Glad to see House is creating a bipartisan oversight committee to make sure coronavirus aid is distributed per law by need to protect against corruption and political favoritism. @senatemajldr should follow suit ASAP. https://t.co/bXeYvtZYiu

Millions are struggling to pay rent today as the coronavirus crushes incomes. We know families were already stressed over the high cost of housing & it’s only going to get worse. That’s why we need far greater investments in affordable housing in the next coronavirus aid bill.

ICYMI: The bill I fought to pass in the Senate included almost $20 billion to support America’s veterans and ensure the VA has the resources it needs to fight COVID-19. Visit my coronavirus resource page to learn more: https://t.co/JjlZYpOa8M

BREAKING NEWS: This is a key moment in our battle against virus/economic implosion. Senate just passed corona 3 aid package: $2 trillion to stabilize families workers businesses housing education agriculture + health care. Here’s the 880 pg bill text: https://t.co/bUXoPg5Bbz https://t.co/sVdNKp0Ebm

As details are finalized on the third coronavirus relief package I'll be pushing out specifics online. This bill (while not perfect) includes a great number of provisions for workers families small businesses nonprofits and our health care system. https://t.co/TtmnsGuORx https://t.co/zp8hvOuovG

We have a deal on third coronavirus relief package—it prioritizes health care workers families & small businesses. We have to realize that any choice between our lives and our livelihoods is a false choice which is why this package supports both health care + the economy. https://t.co/CxO3ZWoAlW

In my Senate office hoping for a vote on 3rd coronavirus bill & wanted to take a second to talk about another critical issue: getting stranded Oregonians & Americans home ASAP. My team & I are working in overdrive to get this done & we won't rest until every Oregonian is home. https://t.co/6fmNXbMCih

Very concerned about state of Corona 3 bill. We can’t shortchange hospitals and health care workers cities and states and small businesses in favor of a big slush fund for huge corporations. Need to take care of workers and families.

The economic wreckage of the coronavirus is hammering small businesses in virtually every sector. We need bold urgent measures to help them—and the families that rely on them. @ChrisMurphyCT @ChrisVanHollen & I are fighting to do just that: https://t.co/VpjFTgwMFW

As we work on a 3rd coronavirus relief package I'm fighting to keep the focus on working families & small biz. Help for industries must come w/ guardrails to ensure they maintain payroll provide paid leave & can't buy back stock. Here are my priorities: https://t.co/2gJvu5lQzm

Congress has passed a second coronavirus relief package and is discussing a third. I’m continuing to put pressure on all negotiations that assistance be focused on families workers and small businesses up — not Wall Street down.

ICYMI: This morning I sent a letter w/ @senwarren @sensanders @ayannapressley & @repkatieporter demanding HUD pause evictions and foreclosures in face of coronavirus. This afternoon HUD followed through suspending actions through April. Details here: https://t.co/0oZjlle4CP https://t.co/BZGE5N3ruB

HAPPENING NOW: I'm holding my monthly Oregon media call and livestreaming it on Facebook to help get coronavirus information out quickly. Follow the link to join: https://t.co/uASlENlNrD https://t.co/f68GPTQ67l

BIG VICTORY: HUD Fannie May and Freddie Mac have all announced they are suspending evictions and foreclosures due to the coronavirus following my and @SenWarren’s push to protect renters and owners from losing their homes. https://t.co/Oeo3gxwv23

Congress is starting discussions on a 3rd major #coronavirus stimulus bill & I made clear ANY bill has to have significant resources for housing: helping people keep their homes in the midst of uncertainty + getting homeless into safe housing during this outbreak. More to come…

UPDATE: Oregon has just been awarded $7.2 million from @CDCgov to support coronavirus response efforts in our state. The federal govt must be a full partner to state + local govts. I will continue pressing for additional resources to help our communities. https://t.co/HdVUbq5D4K

MEANWHILE we must continue to demand IMMEDIATE action on the coronavirus aid package that is now sitting in the Senate. Federal inaction in the face of this pandemic is completely unacceptable and dangerously negligent. (End.) https://t.co/mb7nFrtdHg

How to rate Senate action on the House package to help Americans face the coronavirus:  ⚪️ Friday evening vote: Pretty good. ⚪️ Saturday: A day late. ⚪️ Sunday: Absurd. ⚪️ Monday. A failure in leadership. ⚪️ Tuesday: While Nero fiddles Rome burns. https://t.co/NPRxV7GoLa

This is critically important. I‘m glad the admin heeded our call to ensure every person in the U.S. is able to take the necessary steps to not only protect themselves but to protect everyone in their community by slowing the spread of coronavirus. We must flatten the curve. https://t.co/W22Z2GFPrJ

Now that President Trump has heeded our call to make a presidential disaster declaration communities throughout Oregon and across the country will be able to access much-needed financial assistance as we continue to address the spread of coronavirus.

This deal has essential components for American families as we stand together as a nation to fight against the coronavirus. The House and Senate must act IMMEDIATELY to pass this package. https://t.co/bAlc3eR8jK

IMPORTANT: To minimize the spread of #coronavirus in our communities Governor Brown has issued a statewide closure of OR K-12 schools beginning Monday March 16 through Tuesday March 31. https://t.co/esLtkeulIP

If you think you may have been exposed to the #coronavirus please call your health care provider FIRST before showing up. This will give them a chance to work with you on next steps and protect other patients in their care. Learn more from @CDCgov: https://t.co/fsmsVI2Q8m
To visit the English language CDC coronavirus website click here: https://t.co/Sw4W3hb5K6

Para recomendaciones e información acerca de cómo prevenir la exposición las síntomas conocidas y qué hacer si usted cree que ha estado expuesto al #coronavirus visite el sitio web de los Centros para el Control y la Prevención de Enfermedades (CDC). https://t.co/wNvTukZ2xa

NINE days ago @OregonGovBrown wrote to @VP urgently requesting masks gowns gloves & other equipment to contain coronavirus. Not only has Oregon received none of that equipment they haven't even gotten a response.  No plan no urgency no leadership.

#DidYouKnow: Staying home when you’re sick is one of the best things you can do to limit the spread of viruses and Oregon has a sick time law to make sure you can do just that. Learn more about how it works on my #coronavirus resource page: https://t.co/BKKuv8WmMP

My office is officially ditching the handshake in an effort to promote good public health in the face of the #coronavirus. I’m a fan of the ‘elbow bump’ as a few Oregonians discovered this week over coffee but it’s also okay to just forego physical contact all together. https://t.co/acIyKMhrii

In the face of a serious public health emergency it's completely irresponsible to scare people away from medical care. We're calling on the Trump admin to promise they will not deport people who may be seeking treatment for #COVID19.  READ THE LETTER: https://t.co/1Dwfxpggjq https://t.co/3VFBvaDC4C

As the #coronavirus outbreak reaches Oregon and the NW it’s important to recognize that this virus is now spreading from person-to-person contact & that we need to do all we can to slow that down.  We can all be a part of this effort. Here’s how – RT to spread the word! https://t.co/QRQwZmJ8CQ

The single most important thing we can do to slow the spread of the coronavirus is this: If you feel sick STAY HOME.   Oregonians here is critical info you should know about your right to sick time in our state: https://t.co/NCozQZpJAD

VP Pence came to our caucus meeting today to discuss the latest on the #coronavirus response. I’ve been talking intensively with public health experts and people on the front lines in Oregon and nationally and shared advice I've learned. Here's what I told him.
The arrival of the coronavirus in Oregon raises a lot of important questions. You can find more information recommendations and resources on my website at https://t.co/BKKuv8WmMP.

An important #coronavirus reminder: Ethnicity is not a risk factor for exposure. I stand with @APANONews & Asian Pacific American communities across America as we choose facts over fear. https://t.co/ccO1ILKmf0
🧽 Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces where germs may be lingering. #coronavirus
🤒 Avoid contact with people with they’re sick and stay home yourself when you’re not feeling well to avoid spreading illness. #coronavirus
👏 Use hand sanitizers with at least 60-95% alcohol. #coronavirus
🧼 Wash your hands with soap and water for 20 seconds after you use the restroom before you eat and before you touch your face. #coronavirus

ICYMI: I released a new coronavirus resource page at https://t.co/JjlZYpOa8M. Please visit and share for recommendations on how to limit exposure what to do if you suspect you’ve been exposed and how to create outbreak response plans at your workplace. https://t.co/akAZ8vfyiG

There are 5x as many confirmed cases of the #coronavirus in Canada as Mexico. Why isn’t Donald Trump focused on our northern border? I’ll give you three guesses but you’ll only need one. https://t.co/dzztZuo94j

Trump dismisses global health emergency as “hoax” while WH & Pence muzzle public health experts to control/distort communications. We’ve seen in China & Iran the danger of regimes limiting fact-based health info to protect leaders. Trump is endangering Americans. #coronavirus https://t.co/aOomt0Y9VK

In light of newly confirmed case of coronavirus in OR one of the most important things elected officials can do is make reliable info accessible. That’s why I created a NEW resource page at https://t.co/JjlZYpOa8M for Oregonians to get the info they need to stay safe & healthy.

I have been in touch with @OregonGovBrown and I’ll be speaking with @OHAOregon. I am closely monitoring this situation. In the meantime find recommendations on preventative measures against the #coronavirus at https://t.co/hLXOXPWk6j. https://t.co/p9Y4ewklmD

PLEASE SHARE: I just launched a new resource for people seeking information about the coronavirus (#COVID-19). I outline steps that must be taken to protect Americans + compiled recommendations/resources from @CDCgov  @OHAOregon & @JohnsHopkinsSPH. https://t.co/BKKuv8WmMP https://t.co/1du7hcvV3p

@SenateDems @WhiteHouse @realDonaldTrump @SenJohnKennedy 4. We need to manufacture and deliver testing kits + protective equipment to all 50 states so that local governments emergency responders and health care providers have the resources they need to minimize and mitigate the coronavirus in our communities. https://t.co/YsQn2Gipm0

THREAD: At today’s weekly @SenateDems meeting my colleagues and I discussed CDC’s announcement that our country is poised to face a potentially dangerous outbreak of the coronavirus. There are immediate steps Congress and the WH must take to save lives: https://t.co/G2W6EOnFH1

BREAKING: China has now confirmed > 6000 cases of coronavirus. As the threat to US safety grows @SenToddYoung & I are asking @WHO to declare a public health emergency of int'l concern & issue legally-binding recommendations to stop the disease’s spread. https://t.co/bS0rPg8ZMP https://t.co/vKnnFoTHzJ
